metadata.synopsis: You find him sitting by the river (or with a mirror), staring at his non-reflection. He doesn't even remember what he looks like any more, it's been so long since he's seen his own face. You can lovingly describe his face to him or gaslight him, talking about unsightly moles that he doesn't actually have.

23.speaker: Astarion
23.context: CinematicNodeContext: With his back turned to you. He's holding a mirror, but you can't see it yet.NodeContext: With his back turned to you. He's holding a mirror, but you can't see it yet.

83.speaker: Player
83.text: How did you know I was here?

54.speaker: Astarion
54.text: The only benefit to a mirror when you have my condition.
54.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holds up a mirror to show how he could see youNodeContext: Holds up a mirror to show how he could see you

73.speaker: Astarion
73.text: It doesn't quite make up for the lack of a reflection, mind you.
73.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion watches the player in the mirror as they move through the space where his reflection should be.NodeContext: Astarion watches the player in the mirror as they move through the space where his reflection should be.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: Just looking. What are you doing?

50.speaker: Astarion
50.text: I'm looking too, but not seeing very much.
50.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holds up a mirror to show how he could see youNodeContext: Holds up a mirror to show how he could see you

10.speaker: Astarion
10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion watches the player in the mirror as they move through the space where his reflection should be.NodeContext: Astarion watches the player in the mirror as they move through the space where his reflection should be.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: Do you miss it? Seeing your own face?

84.speaker: Astarion
84.text: Preening in the looking glass? Petty vanity? Of course I miss it.
84.context: NodeContext: last line: a little bitter

34.speaker: Astarion
34.text: It's an indulgence, I'll grant you, but a weakness? A well-presented face can open a lot of doors.

64.speaker: Astarion
64.text: Not that I've seen this face. Not since it grew fangs and its eyes turned red.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: It's a small price to pay for a vampire's power.

19.speaker: Astarion
19.text: To you, maybe. To me it's just another thing Cazador took.

24.speaker: Astarion
24.text: I've never even seen this face. Not since it grew fangs and my eyes turned red.

70.speaker: Astarion
70.text: I... I don't know. I can't remember.

44.speaker: Astarion
44.text: My face is just some dark shape in my past. Another thing I've lost.
44.context: CinematicNodeContext: He hurls the mirror to the ground.NodeContext: He hurls the mirror to the ground.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: Stare into his eyes, taking in every detail of his face.

80.speaker: Astarion
80.text: And what do you see, exactly?

63.speaker: Player
63.text: I'll be your mirror. What do you want to know?

76.speaker: Astarion
76.text: I want to know what the world sees when it looks at me. What you see.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: Count yourself lucky. I have to see this mug every day.

47.speaker: Astarion
47.text: Funny. And what do you see, exactly?

5.speaker: Astarion
5.text: Very good. Now just tell me I'm beautiful and we can call it a day.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: The way your hair curls around your ears.

0.speaker: Astarion
0.text: This is meant to be flattery, not poetry. Just tell me I'm beautiful and we can call it a day.

17.speaker: Astarion
17.text: Mirrors aren't much use, but being reflected in someone else's eyes?

4.speaker: Player
4.text: You're pretty good. Not 'Gale' good, but pretty good.

27.speaker: Astarion
27.text: How dare you! I thought we had something special.

13.speaker: Astarion
13.text: I'd better get some beauty sleep. It seems I need it if I'm to catch up with the competition.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: Karlach is beautiful. You're fine, though.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: You don't have Lae'zel's charm, but you're all right.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: You're fine. Now Shadowheart - there's a beauty!

36.speaker: Player
36.text: Is that all you want? Shallow praise?

57.speaker: Astarion
57.text: Hardly. There's also gold, sex, revenge - quite the list, really.

38.speaker: Astarion
38.text: But failing any of those, I will always settle for shallow praise.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: Your mole definitely grabs my attention.

56.speaker: Astarion
56.context: CinematicNodeContext: Worried. Turns and hurrys awayNodeContext: Worried. Turns and hurrys away

11.speaker: Player
11.text: An elven vampire spawn, approximately 5'11", medium build...

72.speaker: Astarion
72.text: Gods above. Would it kill you to dispense a compliment?

15.speaker: Player
15.text: When you smile, your face wrinkles. It is comforting.

45.speaker: Astarion
45.text: Excuse me? I'm an eternally young vampire, not your doting grandmother.

37.speaker: Astarion
37.text: You can do better. What else?

51.speaker: Player
51.text: Despite being neither brave nor intelligent, you are one of the finest killers I've ever seen.

75.speaker: Astarion
75.context: NodeContext: He just 'complimented' you by calling you stupid and a coward, but a good killer.

60.speaker: Astarion
60.text: Let's leave it there, shall we? It's been a long day and I've had all the compliments I can take.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: I see someone wasting my time.

1.speaker: Astarion
1.text: Oh pardon, I didn't want to inconvenience you with my age-old curse.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: For you maybe, but I like what I see.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: It's for the best, you're not exactly ageing gracefully.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: Sure, but was your mole always so... prominent?

7.speaker: Player
7.text: So is the tadpole causing all that sagging skin, or...

42.speaker: Astarion
42.text: What are you talking about? My skin isn't... is it?
42.context: CinematicNodeContext: Touching his faceNodeContext: Starts touching his face, worried

48.speaker: Astarion
48.context: NodeContext: Blatantly fishing for a compliment

74.speaker: Player
74.text: You have nothing to worry about - it's a very good face.

21.speaker: Astarion
21.text: Is it? What do you see when you look at me?

26.speaker: Astarion
26.context: CinematicNodeContext: He stares down at the mirror in his hands, watching you goNodeContext: He stares down at the mirror in his hands, watching you go
